stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,open,Open note from widget doesn't synchronize first, data loss possible","[Label(name=""Widget :: All Notes""), Label(name=""Widget :: Single Note""), Label(name=""sync"")]","If I open a note from the widget (I'm using a single note widget), and edit the note, changes made from another device might get overridden and therefore lost if not recovered from Nextcloud itself.
It would be better if:
- Notes got synchronized in the background, therefore minimizing the risk of overriding notes because they get synchronized in an interval (every few hours, for example)
- Or, if opened from a widget, the specific note should get synchronized first, and then it should be allowed to edit it
Otherwise, changes made from other devices might get overridden without noticing, resulting in (effective) data loss."

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Favorites in main notes list,"[Label(name=""Discussion""), Label(name=""UX"")]","@dan0xii suggested to sort the notes list by favorite attribute (again). Since this issue is hidden in the discussion of another PR (#275), I'm making it more visible with this separate issue.
## Variants to decide
There are two possibilities of sorting the notes in the app's main activity:
1. First by favorite (favorites first), then by date (recent notes first)
2. Only by date, separate menu item for favorites
## Situation
We had the first variant in the Android app until the navigation drawer was introduced. Now, we have a separate menu item for favorites.
The web app uses the first variant, too. But this may change when introducing categories to the web app - currently, it lacks of separate/filtered notes lists.
The Nextcloud files app doesn't sort by favorite, there we have a separate menu item like in this app now.
## Evaluation

The idea of the favorite feature is to be able to fast find often used notes. This is more effective, if the main list view is sorted by favorites. However, recently modified notes move down in that view and it obsoletes a separate favorites list.
Did I missed something?
## Remarks
This discussion is only about the notes list activity. The notes list widget should be discussed separately (I think that favorites should be first in the widget).
What do you think, @jancborchardt and @stefan-niedermann ?"

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,open,Notes app doesn't work with TLS 1.2,"[Label(name=""sync"")]","This was previously reported on the Notes NextCloud app bug  nextcloud/notes/issues/131

This appears to still be an issue (notes app 0.12.1 installed via F-Droud, LineageOS 14.1 [Android 7.1]).  Enabling the http2 option in nginx implicitly disables pre-1.2 TLS (which is a good idea anyway, as these versions have known vulnerabilities) and prevents the notes app from synchronising.  Disabling http2 allows the notes app to work again.

The NextCloud app, all web browsers that I've tried, DAVDroid, and iOS and macOS calendar and contact sync all all work correctly with http2 enabled (and several of them work noticeably faster), so it's a shame that I have to disable it for the notes app to work."

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Open in read-mode by default,[],"When a new entry is opened, the keyboard is shown and the cursor blinks at the first line; all is fine.

When an existing entry is opened it shows the same behaviour, which doesn't seem logical from a users perspective. The notes have just as much purpose for being read as they have for being edited. Also, the chance that one has to start typing at the beginning of the first line within an existing note  is very small.
It might be more efficient to hide the keyboard by default for existing entries and open the text in read-mode, until the cursor is placed in between the text somewhere by hand.
Consider the following scenario's
**I want to read an existing entry**
_Current behaviour_

I open the entry I want to read from the overview and it opens with the keyboard in sight, blocking half the screen. I have to tick the android back-button to get rid of the keyboard so I can start reading.
_Proposed behaviour (read-only)_
I open the entry I want to read from the overview and it opens the full text. I can immediately start reading and scroll through the text where needed.
**I want to edit an existing entry**
_Current behaviour_
I open the entry I want to edit from the overview and it opens with the keyboard in sight and I want to start editing where I stopped last time.
I have to either scroll through the text with the keyboard in sight (less overview) of I first hide the keyboard so I have more overview of my text (more actions).
_Proposed behaviour (read-only)_
I open the entry I want to edit from the overview, it opens in read-only mode. I want to edit where I stopped last time.
I scroll down to the place where I want to start typing and tap the screen in order to point the cursor there and open the keyboard (edit-mode)
Hopefully this description is clear enough, let me know if you have any questions.
Kind regards"

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,WYSIWYG mode,[],"I think an ""all-user"" notes app should have a WYSIWYG interface. Not as the unique option, but as an option at least. I think that if FLOSS people wants to normalize FLOSS apps and services these should be as easy to use as proprietary commercial apps, if not, common users (my aunt, yours, our doctors who barely can use their Iphones, our pharmacist friend who doesn't even know how to write in bolds in Whatsapp...) shall keep thinking that FLOSS is a complicated and geeky thing, so better stick to Evernote even if learning how to use  ""*"", ""#"", ""==="", media attachment tags and not much more isn't that difficult, but you know, everything that looks like ""coding""... Panic!

Saying this I'm not meaning that NC Notes app should become an HTML editor, on the contrary, I like Markdown's simplicity and easyness to edit when you learn very few and easy rules, but a WYSIWYG interface isn't incompatible and would make a lot of people's life easier. Most of the tools the majority of users would ever need would fit in a simple toolbar with a few buttons, It could even be some floating pop up toolbar, like those in [this plugin for MediumEditor](http://linkesch.com/medium-editor-insert-plugin/) (double clic on a word or single click on the image or video to see the toolbar appear) or in http://telegra.ph, https://sofish.github.io/pen/ and many other online Markdown editors that offer the user a ""werid signs"" free WYSIWYG interface with no clutter, and very ""every-kind-of-user"" friendly.

Of course the users should be able to switch between WYSIWYG and code interfaces, and set whatever they wanted as the default one. Plain text MD edition still is the quickest way to edit for experienced users.
Regards."

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Edit/Preview Activity enhancements,"[Label(name=""Enhancement"")]","Thanks a lot to @schaarsc for #242 !
I have some further ideas for enhancement:

- [x] The ActionBar buttons and menu entries should be consistent for edit mode and for preview mode. Currently, there is a ""Category"" button in edit mode, but none in preview mode. **(high priority)**

- [ ] I suggest a new view mode ""source code"", which contains a native `EditText` without Markdown functionality. This could be useful, if there are problems with `RxMDEditText` or if someone wants to edit text only. **(low priority)**
Edit: Here are some more issues:

- [x] `NoteEditFragment.getNote()` saves implicitely the notes and triggers synchronization. This is kind of bad hack: E.g., when opening a note in edit mode, `saveData()` is called twice (without a need at all), when triggering the favorite action in edit mode, `saveData()` is also called twice (triggering once at the end is sufficient). This should be optimized. **(high priority)**

- [x] The label of the *edit* button is wrong. A good solution would be to add both (edit and preview) buttons to the XML file and then toggle visibility instead of modifying them. **(high priority)**

- [x] I suggest to change the order of the buttons/menu and put the preview/edit button at first position. In my point of view, this is the most important button which should be shown even on devices which are so small that only one button can be shown. **(medium priority)**

- [x] It's good that the mode strings in `EditNoteActivity` (e.g. `edit`, `preview`, ...) were moved to constants. However, there are still two sources of these strings: `arrays.xml` and `EditNoteActivity`. This should be consolidated into one source. E.g., add constant strings to `arrays.xml` (e.g. `<string name=""note_mode_preview"">preview</string>`) and reference those from `string-array` (e.g. `<item>@string/note_mode_preview</item>`) and from `EditNoteActivity` (`getString(R.string.note_mode_preview)`). Another option would be to use class constants and then fill the preference activity manually from these constants. **(low priority)**
- [x] We should do this also for all preference keys, such as `PREF_NOTE_MODE` (but also for the other preferences). But that can be done later. **(low priority)**

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Solution for reserved characters in filenames,[],"I had the issue that my notes were not synced to my windows desktop.
After some investigation I found out that the character "":"" which occured in a ""https://"" URL was not compatible with the NTFS filesystem.
Also the character ""/"" was ignored to satisfy the needs of a unix filesystem.
I personally would like a solution like this:
- Ignoring characters which are not allowed in nextcloud should be default.
- In the configuration menu it is possible to exclude specific characters by ticking checkboxes for windows and maybe also what the mac filesystem need.
- After someone uses one of the special characters the first time, the user is asked to choose if he wants to ignore those characters or not. Also he should ge a hint to the configuration menu.
Also:

The problem doesn't occur in the text itself since it is UTF-8 encoded in owncloud. But the filename seems to be auto generated from the text. Maybe it would be a good idea to make the filename editable in the app.

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Data Loss without Manually Triggered Sync,"[Label(name=""Duplicate"")]","There is a considerable chance of data loss since the app does not sync notes when opening them. I edit my notes both from the app and on my computer.

After changing the note on the PC, it is synced to my nextcloud instance. When opening the same note in the notes app, the locally cached version is displayed and even if I leave the note without editing, this version is then synced up and overwrites the other data.

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,New feature: set a note as favorite (star/unstar),[],"Setting a note as favorite was already introduced on the server side (owncloud/notes#248 and nextcloud/notes#4) and can be used to stick important notes to the top of the list in order to find them easier (cp. #92). My changes here introduce this feature for the android app.

Beside this, I did some necessary refactoring in the `NotesListViewActivity`/`ItemAdapter`: (re-)loading the list of notes is now done in an `AsyncTask` and reuses the `ItemAdapter` instance (instead of creating a new instance on every refresh). As a result, the list of notes does not jump to the top anymore (cp. #118).

The implementation of the favorite feature is straight forward and has no special treatment for old(*) server app versions (i.e., versions that do not support the favorite feature). As a result, if a user sets a note as favorite, the star disappears after the next synchronization with an old server app. This behavior can be improved with some effort:
a) activate the feature only on demand => add a checkbox to the settings activity and only show the favorite feature, if this checkbox is activated

b) detect server features automatically => like a), but instead of setting the checkbox by the user, the app has to check if the server uses an appropriate version. This requires changes in the server API (e.g. an `info` URL which returns a JSON with the version number) and its unclear, at which point of time the app should check this in order to detect updates of the server app.

c) activate the feature, but keep the local state if the server result does not contain any information about favorites => requires some changes in the app; problem: when the user updates the server app he/she will lose the local favorites setting (the server favorites will overwrite the local favorites). In order to improve this, some more effort is needed, e.g. a new DB column is required, which notices if the local meta data (i.e. favorite setting) was changed and not yet synchronized. Therefore, this solution requires the most effort (I didn't see this in my first estimation: https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/OwnCloud-Notes/issues/92#issuecomment-256010808).
As an overall consequence, I would leave this as is -- for now. If a better downward compatibility is required, then we can do this in a separate commit/pull request.
(*) today, ""old server app"" means also the current official version of the server app. For now, the favorite feature is only in the git `master` branch and is waiting for the next release.

stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes,closed,Fixing sychronization and concurrency issues,[],This is the current state of my attempt to fix #117. It's not fully finished yet, but the majority of the work is done. Therefore, please have a look at this pull request and test it with all the test cases you can imagine. I will update the pull request continually.
#### Finished Tasks
- [x] **Database:** new column `REMOTE_ID` (fixes conflicts between parallel creation of different notes locally and remotely)
- [x] **DBStatus:** `LOCAL_CREATED` is not used anymore (distinction if Note is new or edited can be made with checking `REMOTE_ID=0`; fixes conflicts on synchronization and parallel local edits)
- [x] **Note:** model is split in to `DBNote` (representing the local DB entry of a note) and `OwnCloudNote` (representing the remote note, used by `NotesClient`).
- [x] **ItemAdapter/note item layout:** show icon for unsynchronized changes (simplifies debugging, includes all changes done in #121, closes #119)
- [x] **NoteSQLiteOpenHelper:** database upgrade (add the new column and adapts the data without flushing the database)
- [x] **NoteSQLiteOpenHelper:** add more constraints for database updates (fixes lost updates due to parallel changes of notes (from synchronization and user interface))
- [x] **NoteSQLiteOpenHelper:** `updateNoteAndSync()`: only make database changes, if the content really changed (fixes #104, at least the original intention of the author).
- [x] **NoteSQLiteOpenHelper:** remove recurrent code (improves code quality)
- [x] **NoteServerSyncHelper:** only update if network is connected (fixes lots of thrown exceptions)
- [x] **NoteServerSyncHelper:** schedule synchronization requests (if synchronization is active or network not connected; fixes missing push of _all_ outstanding changes)
- [x] **NoteServerSyncHelper:** restructure the communication between synchronization task and user interface.
- [x] **NoteServerSyncHelper:** consolidate synchronization AsyncTasks into a single one (improves code quality)

- [x] **EditNoteActivity:** ensures, that auto-save is not called, if the previous auto-save is still running. In addition, start next auto-save not before a small delay has passed. (This could fix #76)
#### Other Issues I've Found (not covered by this pull request)

- There is no conflict resolution for the case that a Note is locally and remotely edited in parallel (e.g. during a longer time without network connection). Currently, local changes overwrite remote changed. We have to discuss what would be the desired behavior. See also #66.
- The `ItemAdapter` should use a `CursorAdapter` which is updated automatically if the backend data is changed.

- In order to save traffic during synchronization, `pullRemoteChanges()` could use the `exclude` parameter of the [Notes API](https://github.com/owncloud/notes/wiki/Notes-0.2) in a first step to check which notes changed without downloading unchanged notes. Only in the second step, the whole note content would be downloaded from the changed note. This could save traffic, however, it has to be investigated if the effort worth it (what is the typical/topmost number and size of notes?).
